CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 27, 1939, pg. 18, reads: "Gaines Funeral Home Reflects 'The World of Tomorrow' Most Modern Equipment Plus Scientific, Efficient Service Marks New Step Forward ... Pictures reading top left to right: ... HEARSES - limousines and service cars. Photograph shows attendants beside Mr. Gaines' fleet of hearses, limousines and service cars.  in background is an exterior view of the funeral chapel....THE FUNERAL services may be held in the home, in the church or in Gaines' well appointed chapel.  Complete arrangements for the services will be made by one of the staff, including the minister of the family's choice, the music and musicians and even the pallbearers, if desired. - Photos by Harris ... George W. Gaines, Director of Funerals ... 220 Auburn Street, E. E., Pittsburgh, Pa."
TitMainTitle: Gaines Funeral Church with five hearses and cars and attendants, 220 Auburn Street, East Liberty
